content.description:
Many good problems line the north side of the creek, this is one of the better ones.

Bomber granite with good holds and fun topout, but might leave some scratching their heads until the right beta is used. (hint- U might have to K BAR)

Alternate(harder) start begins on the far right side, almost in a little cave. Find the lowest holds above the slimy cave and climb a burly compression problem into the middle of U K Bar. probably v6
content.location:
As you're walking up the trail from the parking, you'll see a small granite cliff on the opposite side of the river. Cross where you can and head more or less to the center of the formation.

U K BAR starts on the steepest face on good holds. Work up and slightly right on jugs then straight up the overhang using small crimps. Topout on good holds at the lip
